solution.text:
The adjacent angles of a parallelogram always add up to \(180^o\).
Let the angles be \(_{j}_x\) and \(_{{10-j}}_x\).
Now, \(_{j}_x + _{{10-j}}_x = 10x = 180\)
\(x=18\)
Therefore, smallest angle is \(_{{min(j,10-j)}}_x=_{{min(j,10-j)}}_ \times 18= _{{min(j,10-j)*18}}_\)

content.text: Two adjacent angles of a parallelogram are in the ratio _{j}_:_{{10-j}}_. Find the smallest angle
